intro: Amyema longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed amyema, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental value. Amyema longipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
